newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Wilson & Horton launches new-look Herald.
newsitem.headline: Wilson & Horton launches new-look Herald.

text.p: Publisher Wilson and Horton on Monday unleashed a new-look New Zealand Herald on readers in a bid to arrest its declining circulation.
The changes at the Herald had taken place after several months of appraisal, using a team of consultants.
Wilson and Horton's flagship publication now sports a blue masthead and a radically altered front page.
"From today, the Herald takes on a new shape which has been designed to meet a number of challenges put to us by readers," the Herald said.
The paper's index has been expanded and moved from page one to two. The paper has added new columnists, a metro edition and a North Island edition to its arsenal.
The paper also carries a news review section and has added a new cartoonist.
The second section of the Herald has been completely redesigned. On Thursday, the company will launch a new weekly entertainment colour liftout.
Wilson & Horton is 45 percent owned by Dublin-based Independent Newspapers, and interests associated with Independent's principal, Tony O'Reilly.
